snippet: The deaths of two horses at the Grand National meeting at Aintree Racecourse have dampened spirits before the main event and reignited concerns over the forbidding fences.
abstract: Death of two horses during Grand National meeting at England's Aintree Racecourse dampens spirits on eve of Grand National steeplechase, and reignites debate over whether fences at event are too dangerous.
lead_paragraph: The deaths of two horses at the Grand National meeting at Aintree Racecourse have dampened spirits before the main event and reignited concerns over the forbidding fences.

headline.seo: Death of Second Horse at Grand National Reignites Concerns Over Fences
headline.main: Death Again Visits a Racecourse on Trial
headline.print_headline: Death Again Visits a Tradition on Trial
